meanings.def: to rub something against a surface, in order to remove dirt or liquid from it; to rub a surface with a cloth, etc. in order to clean it
examples: wipe something (on something) Please wipe your feet on the mat.
He wiped his hands on a clean towel.
wipe something with something She was sniffing and wiping her eyes with a tissue.
wipe something + adj. He wiped his plate clean with a piece of bread.
The plastic surface can be easily wiped.
When you've finished with it, simply wipe it clean with a damp cloth.

meanings.def: to remove dirt, liquid, etc. from something by using a cloth, your hand, etc.
examples: wipe something (from/off something) He wiped the sweat from his forehead.
wipe something away/off/up She wiped off her make-up.
Use that cloth to wipe up the mess.
She gently wiped the tears from her eyes.
I wiped up the spilled wine.
He wiped the marks off the wall.
He paused to wipe the sweat from his forehead.

meanings.def: to remove information, sound, images, etc. from a computer, video, etc.
examples: wipe something off (something) You must have wiped off that programme I recorded.
wipe something Somebody had wiped all the tapes.

meanings.def: to deliberately forget an experience because it was unpleasant or embarrassing
examples: wipe something from something I tried to wipe the whole episode from my mind.
wipe something out You can never wipe out the past.

meanings.def: to defeat somebody completely in an argument or a competition
to stop smiling, especially because somebody else is annoyed and does not think the situation is funny
examples: Wipe that grin off your face and get back to work.
Wipe that stupid smile off your face.

meanings.def: to destroy or remove somebody/something completely
to agree to forget about past mistakes or arguments and start again with a relationship
